candidate Profile Description.summary: Hamed Khosravi is an Industrial Engineering Ph.D. student at West Virginia University specializing in Decision Sciences. With a strong foundation in data analysis, machine learning, and optimization, he has contributed to various research projects and publications. Hamed is proficient in Python, R, MATLAB, SQL, and Power BI, and has certifications in data science and machine learning.

research_experience.title: Data Science Research Assistant
projects: Proposed a novel feature selection model based on local search and chaos mapping called binary group teaching optimization algorithm (BGTOALC).

Developed a novel copula-based data augmentation method specifically tailored to be used for binary data named binary gaussian copula synthesizer (BGCS), to improve the performance of machine learning models by outperforming other data augmentation techniques.
Developed a novel enhanced farmland fertility algorithm using new adaptive operator for global optimization.

Proposed a novel modification of the Linear upper confidence bound (LinUCB) method for the stochastic multi-armed contextual bandit with integrating the k nearest neighbors (kNN) and introducing dynamic exploration rate named LinUCB-kNN.

research_experience.title: Autonomous Experimentation Platform Design for Accelerating Manufacturing of Advanced Materials
projects: Presented a novel sequential learning method named multi-objective bayesian optimization with sequential learning (MOBOSL) to optimize multi-objective manufacturing decisions.
Introduced a new performance metric called adjusted proportional hypervolume (APHV) to assess models in multi-objective optimization problems.
Proposed a surprise-guided acquisition function integrating conditional tabular Generative Adversarial Network (CTGAN) in sequential learning framework to approximate a black-box function.

research_experience.title: Utilizing AI in Healthcare: Advancements and Applications
projects: Presented a practical machine learning-based clinical decision support system (CDSS) incorporating decision tree model to assist clinicians in making evidence- based decisions regarding early dialysis prediction for chronic kidney disease (CKD) patients.

Developed and implemented advanced machine learning models using oversampling techniques and ensemble learning in a mental health analytics project, achieving a 19% improvement in the prediction accuracy of suicide ideation compared to baseline models.
